note: translations The works of Plato on which I comment in this book are Apology, Euthyphro, Gorgias, Laws, Meno, Parmenides, Phaedo, Phaedrus, Philebus, Protagoras, Republic, Sophist, Statesman (= Politicus), Symposium, Theaetetus and Timaeus.
title: The bibliography on Plato is vast. Many discussions focus on particular works, topics, or arguments. Those that are relevant to the subjects of each chapter are included in the Further Reading in each chapter. Here I give some general guidance to translations (into English) and works that range over the whole of Plato
Translations of all these are found in
Most translations are of only a single work of Plato; and these are detailed under the chapters in which each of these works is mainly discussed. One excellent set is the
